transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hey Zhi, this is Arjun over at MongoDB. Is now a good time to chat for a couple of minutes?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, yeah, I’ve got a few minutes. What’s up?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great, thank you! I noticed Acme Corp.’s been in the news about your cost optimization initiative. Are you involved in that at all?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, that's pretty much on my desk these days. We’re looking at everything, honestly.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Makes sense. I’m reaching out because a lot of gaming teams are switching from DynamoDB to Atlas to reduce TCO and simplify ops—especially around scaling and data model flexibility. Is that something you’re wrestling with?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, DynamoDB’s okay, but it gets expensive at scale. Still, migration sounds… risky. Like, downtime risk, dev time, all that.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally hear you, and, honestly, that’s top of mind for everyone. We actually have a bunch of migration tooling and a specialized team to help gaming companies do it with minimal downtime. Would it help if I sent specifics on how that works?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, yeah. Could you share examples, maybe?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. I can send some case studies from studios we've helped, and a breakdown of how we managed live game migrations. Are you mostly worried about player data, or is it backend systems too?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Both, honestly. But, uh, security is probably my first question. How’s Atlas with compliance? We’re under a lot of scrutiny there.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah—Atlas is SOC 2, ISO, PCI compliant out of the box and you get built-in encryption. We also do automated audits and granular access control, which helps a lot for game data privacy. Is there a specific compliance framework you’re worried about?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, mostly GDPR for our EU titles.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yup, Atlas supports data residency controls, so you can pin data in specific regions for GDPR compliance. Can definitely include more on that in my email.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay, cool. I mean, send me what you’ve got, I’ll take a look and maybe loop in my lead dev.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Perfect, I’ll put together a short deck, some case studies, and the migration process details. Is there anything else I should include for your team?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Maybe some pricing guidelines? We’re getting hammered on cost questions.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely—I’ll share a pricing model comparison. What’s the best email for you?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: zhi@acmecorp.com works. Thanks for reaching out, Arjun.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thank you, Zhi. I’ll follow up shortly—let me know if you have any other questions.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Will do. Bye.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Take care!
